key_changes.change: Economist Red brand colour applied to header and footer
key_changes.details: Header and footer background changed from grayscale (#ffffff / #1a1a1a) to Economist Red (#E3120B). All nav links, logo text, and footer content updated to white for contrast. Red-dark (#B80E08) used for hover states.

All colours, shadows, border radii, transitions, and font stacks now defined as :root CSS custom properties (--red, --red-dark, --white, --ink, --body-text, --muted, --border, --shadow-sm/md/lg, --radius, --transition, --font, --container). Enables single-point updates across the entire page.

key_changes.change: SVG logo integrated in header and footer
key_changes.details: Replaced plain text 'NovaPharm Healthcare' logo with . CSS filter: brightness(0) invert(1) applied to render logo in white on red background. No separate white SVG variant required. Logo wordmark includes name + regulatory tagline.
Added sub-label 'MHRA Regulated · GDP Compliant' beneath the logo name in the header for instant regulatory credibility signal.

Heading sizes now use clamp() for fluid scaling across all screen sizes without additional media queries. h1: clamp(2rem, 4vw, 3rem), h2: clamp(1.5rem, 3vw, 2.25rem). Hero h1: clamp(2.2rem, 5vw, 3.4rem).

Cards use a CSS ::before pseudo-element red top-border that sweeps in from left using scaleX(0) to scaleX(1) on hover with transform-origin: left. Subtle, premium, and performant (GPU-accelerated transform).
key_changes.implementation: card::before { scaleX(0) → scaleX(1) on :hover, transition: 0.28s ease }

key_changes.details: Each card now has a small icon container (.card-icon) with a light red tint background (#FFF0EF) displaying a contextually relevant emoji icon for visual scanning. Improves layout hierarchy and visual engagement.

key_changes.change: Hero section redesigned to Fortune 500 layout
key_changes.details: Hero rebuilt with eyebrow label (red line + uppercase text), large fluid headline, muted lead paragraph, dual CTA buttons, and a trust strip (horizontal divider + compliance badges). Modelled on enterprise SaaS/pharma leader layouts.
Each section now opens with a small red eyebrow label (e.g. 'How We Source', 'Who We Serve', 'Infrastructure', 'Our Reach', 'Leadership') above the h2, matching enterprise website patterns.

key_changes.change: CTA section redesigned as full-bleed red banner
key_changes.details: Bottom CTA replaced with a full-width Economist Red banner (.cta-banner) with two-column layout — left: headline + lead text; right: action buttons. White and ghost button variants used for contrast on red.
key_changes.previous: Plain white section with two buttons
key_changes.new: Full-bleed #E3120B banner with flex two-column layout

key_changes.details: Added a 4-column stats strip below the supply chain cards showing EU-GMP, 100% GDP, MHRA, and UK-Wide as visual proof points.

Footer rebuilt with a 4-column grid: (1) brand description with logo, (2) navigation links, (3) contact details with email + address, (4) regulatory info. Column headings use uppercase letter-spaced style. Footer bottom bar contains copyright, Companies House link, Privacy Policy, and Terms links.

Button variants expanded: btn-white (white bg / red text), btn-ghost (transparent / white border), btn-red (red bg / white text), btn-outline-red (transparent / red border), btn-sm (smaller size). All have hover transforms, box-shadow, and transition.

Trust badges moved from hero center area into a horizontal trust strip below the CTAs with a divider line. Badges styled with dark ink border and ink text (not red) for a more formal, compliance-focused appearance. Added 'Pharmacovigilance Active' as fourth badge.
